patterns_discovered.description: Using Material-UI sx prop with breakpoint-based gridTemplateColumns to achieve responsive grid layouts
patterns_discovered.context: Skeleton loading state displays 2 columns on extra-small screens (xs) and 4 columns on medium screens and up (md)

patterns_discovered.description: Leveraging MUI breakpoint system (xs, md) for mobile-first responsive design
patterns_discovered.context: Applied to skeleton grid to match expected responsive behavior

gotchas_discovered.description: Skeleton loading state grids must match the responsive layout of the actual content to maintain visual consistency during loading
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Ensure skeleton gridTemplateColumns breakpoints mirror the actual content grid layout

gotchas_discovered.description: Static 4-column grid without responsive behavior can cause layout shift and poor UX on mobile devices
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Always include responsive breakpoint variants in grid layouts

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully updated AreasPage skeleton grid to be responsive using MUI breakpoint system
approach_outcome.implementation_strategy: Single-line modification using sx prop breakpoint values
key_changes: Added xs breakpoint with 2-column grid layout for mobile devices
Maintained md breakpoint with 4-column grid layout for larger screens

recommendations.description: Review other skeleton loading states in the application to ensure they also use responsive breakpoints matching their corresponding content grids
Consider creating a reusable responsive grid configuration utility to prevent duplication of responsive breakpoint logic across components
Document the standard responsive breakpoint configurations used in the application for consistency across components
